Reviews.Title: “A stay I'll always remember - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ben E
Reviews.Content: Visited here at the end of 2009 on a backpacking trip around Europe with a friend. The price is unbeatable for the location, very central - 2mins from the main train and bus terminal, 10 mins to the colosseum, 15 mins to the Spanish steps. We arrived at about 9am on a night train, the Signora who runs this place (doesn't speak any English) let us in to drop off our bags, let us take a shower and cooked us some breakfast! Very nice! Between my broken Italian and her hand gestures she explained the best way to all the sites, and lent us hidden money pouches to wear. This place does need some work doing to it, and there is a feel that you are just stopping in her front room, but we had great service and good stay there all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice signora!”
Reviews.Author: ile_de_la_cite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a long time ago, in October, 2003 (not 2010). It was very cheap, 25 euros plus 2 for breakfast, which was quite good (coffee, juice, 2 big loaves of bread, jam, butter and Nutella). Signora Silvia, the nice old owner, even added a piece of fruit, just for me, when I told her I was traveling on a very tight budget. The room was simple, without bathroom. It´s on an old building, really close to Stazione Termini. Maybe all neighbourhoods around train sations aren´t the prettiest, but I felt more confortable walking during daytime. Excellent value, I recomended it to friends, that went, and liked it too.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and homely - we'd definately reccommend it”
Reviews.Author: Kerry_and_Brian
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel just by chance and would highly recommend it for travellers on a budget. The quirky owner is a really nice man with a kind heart. He speaks good english and is happy to help out whenever you need it. The rooms are big and airy and the bathrooms clean and functional. If you want to experience an authentic italian family run place then stay here. We would definately go back and this is largely due to the kind owner.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't wait to leave...”
Reviews.Author: amsterduo
Reviews.Content: -The Church bell rings constantly around 6am. -The beds are extremely uncomfortablle. -The customer service is the worst I have ever come by. -The staff is not helpful with directions, sites, or anything concerning our stay. -The bathrooms were really dirty, not messy, but dirty. -If you are expecting internet, don't. -Make sure that you make it on time. Our plane had been late due to a security issue with a person on the plane. We called in advance and they said if we were one minute late they would cancel our reservation. Even though they live at the place and could have let us in one minute later. -The area is not safe at night. Make sure you have someone with you. The place is on the fourth floor and you walk up very dark stairs at night. -Honestly, the list goes on and on. We backpacked for 3 weeks and absolutely loved everywhere we stayed but this place was a nightmare. I am not usually unhappy with service but this was beyond poor. Spend the extra money and go somewhere else. I saw the mixed reviews of the place on here and thought we would give it a try; it was NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, great location, clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: KLREdmonds
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews so was a bit apprehensive, but with the good price I decided to go for it and stay there. My partner and I stayed there for 4 nights. It was clean, had a good location right by Termini train station and just around the block from an internet place. The mother and her son (I think) were very very nice, helpful. I would definitely recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would I go back, probably not...”
Reviews.Author: 2009TravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this place because the older woman running it is so sweet. Loved her. Unfortunately she was the only highlight. Her son was a pain. He is like the Bill Heder character on SNL who interviews in Italian. The room was fine, but had to keep window open in hot summer and I got so many bug bites. I was glad to move on and will probably not go back. Near the train station and did not always feel safe. Woke up one morning and there was blood at the bottom of the stairs. Should have spent money on a hotel. Admittedly, this was my first time traveling this way, but of the six places I stayed this ranked five or six...

Reviews.Title: “Good price and an okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3monthsineurope
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than 5 minutes from the train station but is on the 5th floor and the lift was not working while we were there. It is at least 20 minutes walk to the major attractions (forum, coluseum, etc...). The room was very cold an night in February and we had no control over the heat. The shared bathroom is strange because it has no shower curtain and water gets everywhere when you take a shower. The price is good for Rome which is an expensive city and the double room was pretty big for the price. The owner let us use his fridge for our groceries which was nice. The area is perfectly safe which is good since it is near the main train station. Also, we had to pay in cash which was somewhat of an inconvenience since it was a large amount for 4 nights. Overall I would stay here again but would probably look for some other places first with shower curtains.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: creekgirl
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here and we both very much enjoyed our stay. Our hosts were great and warned us of the do's and don'ts although we did get pickpocketed on the subway. The location was perfect for us to catch buses and trains. Small markets and shops to purchase water, food and wine!! Internet cafes just around the corner. It's quite, clean and we felt safe staying there, we both would come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: JanetCanda
Reviews.Content: While the accommodations are inexpensive (which is hard to find in Rome), the place was in need of repair and an upgrade. The location was excellent, very close the major train station. On the upside, the owners were very friendly and accommodating. Plus, we booked a 3 bed room, but because there were only two of us, we were only chared for 2.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: kirinhoney
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the triple room. It was big and nice. The staff are very kind and helpful, especially the lady. She can't speak Engliash but she tried very hard to recommend us about where to go and warned us about the pickpocket. We used a lot of body language.

HotelInfo.Name: Pensione Giamaica
HotelInfo.Address: Via Magenta 13, 00185 Rome, Italy
